Reset counts if required

David correctly noted that
```java
if (!mLrnQueue.isEmpty() && mRevCount == 0 && mNewCount == 0) {
```
May be wrog because of the count not resets. He is entirely right. I thought I checkde for all counts, and that it was
always called:
* in getCard, so that it is really reset.
* in order to increment/decrement it; in which case we would increment/decrement a wrong number, which is not actually a
  problem since reset will take this change into account

However, in answer Card, we actually need the number of cards to know whether we should put the new card in second
position instead of first one.

This probably is not related to any current problem however, because the only difference is whether the card is moved
from first to second position. The problem we have is inverse, that a card is moved to first or last position.

In my opinion, a better solution if we have no counts would be to check whether new/rev queue is not empty. It's always
nice to fill it. But that would change the code to much for a really small improvement
